to get the zeros in our matrix so that we can use the Laplace expansion to find the determinant. To use an elementary transformation simply means to multiply a row of a matrix by some number and adding it to some other row. Obviously, the end-goal of performing elementary transformations is to get zeros along some column of the given matrix so that we can use Laplace expansion to calculate the determinant.
